content.projectDesc:
I make computers do funny interactive things, and believe that games can inspire & move us. I want to be part of helping creators have the tools and skills to make these games - in the way they want.

previously @ Unity Technologies as a Software Engineer Intern, Engine Support (July 2022 -> June 2023)

most of this website is written in C++, using raylib for the graphics rendering, and nlohmann/json for parsing the data forming the content output. intended to build up familiarity with WebAssembly toolchains & raylib, and experimenting with having a website primarily driven by C++

Unity Technologies 2022 Hackweek project - experiment in putting Unity WebGL builds in places they shouldn\'t be.
worked on with one of the other interns on my team, it spawned from the reality that "check out my game" is a common way to install malware. we wanted to take advantage of modern browser sandboxing, while allowing for the ease of sharing that a simple zipped build provides.
the project started by packaging all the data required for a Unity build into a single HTML file, such that it could be loaded independently.
due to SVGs also allowing for JavaScript execution, we then ported this to be compatible with SVG, allowing for entire Unity builds to be shared on any social network that doesn\'t rasterize SVGs, with a live demo of this avaliable on cohost.org
